The standard way to generate keys on a smartcard with GnuPG is to create the encryption subkey with gpg and to move this key to the smartcard. A password protected backup file named sk_<keyid>.gpg is also created so that in the case of a lost or broken smartcard, the key can be restored to a new smartcard to allow decryption of existing data. Unfortunately with some versions of GnuPG an additional unprotected copy of the encryption subkey is also kept on disk.
All possibly affected users should check whether such an unintended copy of a smartcard key exists and delete it.

package main import ( "fmt" "math" "math/rand/v2" "github.com/goark/mt/v2/mt19937" ) func main() { rnd := rand.New(mt19937.New(rand.Int64())) points := []float64{} max := 0.0 min := 1.0 sum := 0.0 for range 10000 { point := rnd.NormFloat64() points = append(points, point) min = math.Min(min, point) max = math.Max(max, point) sum += point } n := float64(len(points)) ave := sum / n d2 := 0.0 for _, p := range points { d2 += (p - ave) * (p - ave) } fmt.Println(" minimum: ", min) fmt.Println(" maximum: ", max) fmt.Println(" average: ", ave) fmt.Println("standard deviation: ", math.Sqrt(d2/n)) } ã“ã‚Œã‚’å®Ÿè¡Œã™ã‚‹ã¨ã“ã‚“ãªæ„Ÿã˜ã«ãªã‚‹ã€‚

Go 1.22 ã® math/rand ãƒ‘ãƒƒã‚±ãƒ¼ã‚¸ã¨è¿½åŠ ã•ã‚ŒãŸ math/rand/v2 ãƒ‘ãƒƒã‚±ãƒ¼ã‚¸ã‚’çœºã‚ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã€‚
ãŠãã‚‰ã Go 1.22 ã«ãŠã‘ã‚‹ç–‘ä¼¼ä¹±æ•°é–¢é€£ã®æœ€å¤§ã®ãƒˆãƒ”ãƒƒã‚¯ã¯ ChaCha8 ãŒãƒ©ãƒ³ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒ ã«çµ„ã¿è¾¼ã¾ã‚Œï¼Œç–‘ä¼¼ä¹±æ•°ç”Ÿæˆå™¨ã®æ—¢å®šã‚¢ãƒ«ã‚´ãƒªã‚ºãƒ ã«ãªã£ãŸã“ã¨ã ã‚ã†ã€‚
The Salsa20 family of stream ciphers : ã“ã‚ŒãŒãƒ™ãƒ¼ã‚¹ã«ãªã‚‹è«–æ–‡ã‹ãª Salsa20 - Wikipedia C2SP/chacha8rand.md at main Â· C2SP/C2SP Â· GitHub ã¤ãã£ã¦ç†è§£ã™ã‚‹ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒªãƒ¼ãƒ æš—å· ChaCha20 - ã¡ã‚Šã‚‚ã¤ã‚‚ã‚Œã°ãƒŸãƒ«ã‚­ãƒ¼ã‚¦ã‚§ã‚¤ : Go ã§ã‚µãƒ³ãƒ—ãƒ«ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã‚’æ›¸ã„ã¦ãŠã‚‰ã‚Œã‚‹ã€‚ã‚ã‚ŠãŒãŸã‚„ ChaCha ã¯ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒªãƒ¼ãƒ æš—å·ã®ä¸€ç¨®ã§ï¼Œç°¡å˜ã«è¨€ã†ã¨ï¼Œç–‘ä¼¼ä¹±æ•°ã‚’ç”Ÿæˆã—ã¦ãã‚Œã‚’å¹³æ–‡ã¨ XOR ã™ã‚‹ã¨ã„ã†ã‚‚ã®ã‚‰ã—ã„ã€‚ ã“ã®ã†ã¡ã®ç–‘ä¼¼ä¹±æ•°ã‚’ç”Ÿæˆã™ã‚‹éƒ¨åˆ†ã‚’åˆ‡ã‚Šå‡ºã—ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã‚ˆã†ã ã€‚ ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒªãƒ¼ãƒ æš—å·ã«ä½¿ã†ã‚‚ã®ãªã®ã§ï¼Œæš—å·æŠ€è¡“çš„ã«ã‚»ã‚­ãƒ¥ã‚¢ã§ã‹ã¤é€Ÿã„ã¨ã„ã†ã®ãŒç‰¹å¾´ã«ãªã‚‹ã ã‚ã†ã‹ã€‚ ã¡ãªã¿ã« ChaCha ã®å¾Œã‚ã«ã¤ã„ã¦ã„ã‚‹ 20 ã¨ã‹ 8 ã¨ã‹ã¯ãƒ©ã‚¦ãƒ³ãƒ‰æ•°ã‚’ç¤ºã—ã¦ã„ã‚‹ãã†ãªã€‚
ChaCha ã¯ OpenSSL ã ã‹ OpenSSH ã ã‹ã§ã‚‚è¦‹ã‹ã‘ãŸã‚ˆã†ãªï¼ˆã†ã‚è¦šãˆï¼‰ã€‚ ã‚‚ã—çµåŸæµ©ã•ã‚“ãŒã€æš—å·æŠ€è¡“å…¥é–€ã€ã®ç¬¬4ç‰ˆã‚’å‡ºã•ã‚Œã‚‹æ©Ÿä¼šãŒã‚ã‚Œã°ï¼Œä»˜éŒ²ã§ã„ã„ã®ã§æ˜¯é ChaCha ã«ã‚‚è¨€åŠã—ã¦æ¬²ã—ã„ã€‚
ãƒ©ãƒ³ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒ ã« ChaCha8 ç–‘ä¼¼ä¹±æ•°ç”Ÿæˆå™¨ã‚’çµ„ã¿è¾¼ã‚€ ChaCha8 ç–‘ä¼¼ä¹±æ•°ç”Ÿæˆå™¨ã®ã‚¢ãƒ«ã‚´ãƒªã‚ºãƒ ã¯ internal/chacha8rand ãƒ‘ãƒƒã‚±ãƒ¼ã‚¸ã«å®Ÿè£…ã•ã‚Œã¦ã„ã‚‹ã€‚ ä¸­èº«ã«ã¤ã„ã¦ã¯å‰²æ„›ã•ã›ã¦ã‚‚ã‚‰ã†ã€‚ Internal ãƒ‘ãƒƒã‚±ãƒ¼ã‚¸ãªã®ã§ï¼Œã‚µãƒ¼ãƒ‰ãƒ‘ãƒ¼ãƒ†ã‚£ã®ãƒ‘ãƒƒã‚±ãƒ¼ã‚¸ã‹ã‚‰ã¯ç›´æ¥å‚ç…§ã§ããªã„ã€‚
ã¾ãšã¯ runtime ãƒ‘ãƒƒã‚±ãƒ¼ã‚¸ã«çµ„ã¿è¾¼ã‚“ã§ã„ã‚‹éƒ¨åˆ†ã‚’è¦‹ã¦ã¿ã‚‹ã€‚ ã¡ã‚‡ã£ã¨é•·ã„ã‘ã©ã”å®¹èµ¦ã€‚
// OS-specific startup can set startupRand if the OS passes // random data to the process at startup time. // For example Linux passes 16 bytes in the auxv vector. var startupRand []byte // globalRand holds the global random state. // It is only used at startup and for creating new m's. // Otherwise the per-m random state should be used // by calling goodrand. var globalRand struct { lock mutex seed [32]byte state chacha8rand.State init bool } var readRandomFailed bool // randinit initializes the global random state. // It must be called before any use of grand. func randinit() { lock(&globalRand.lock) if globalRand.init { fatal("randinit twice") } seed := &globalRand.seed if startupRand != nil { for i, c := range startupRand { seed[i%len(seed)] ^= c } clear(startupRand) startupRand = nil } else { if readRandom(seed[:]) != len(seed) { // readRandom should never fail, but if it does we'd rather // not make Go binaries completely unusable, so make up // some random data based on the current time. readRandomFailed = true readTimeRandom(seed[:]) } } globalRand.state.Init(*seed) clear(seed[:]) globalRand.init = true unlock(&globalRand.lock) } // readTimeRandom stretches any entropy in the current time // into entropy the length of r and XORs it into r. // This is a fallback for when readRandom does not read // the full requested amount. // Whatever entropy r already contained is preserved. func readTimeRandom(r []byte) { // Inspired by wyrand. // An earlier version of this code used getg().m.procid as well, // but note that this is called so early in startup that procid // is not initialized yet. v := uint64(nanotime()) for len(r) > 0 { v ^= 0xa0761d6478bd642f v *= 0xe7037ed1a0b428db size := 8 if len(r) < 8 { size = len(r) } for i := 0; i < size; i++ { r[i] ^= byte(v >> (8 * i)) } r = r[size:] v = v>>32 | v<<32 } } via runtime/rand.go ã“ã‚Œã¯ç–‘ä¼¼ä¹±æ•°ç”Ÿæˆå™¨ã®çŠ¶æ…‹ï¼ˆä¸»ã« seedï¼‰ã‚’ç®¡ç†ã—ã¦ã‚‹éƒ¨åˆ†ã‹ãªã€‚ æœ€åˆã® seed ã¯ä¹±æ•°ãƒ‡ãƒã‚¤ã‚¹ã‹ã‚‰å–ã£ã¦ã‚‹ã‚“ã ã­ã€‚ ã“ã‚Œã«å¤±æ•—ã™ã‚‹ã¨æ™‚åˆ»ã‹ã‚‰ç”Ÿæˆã™ã‚‹ï¼Œã¨ã€‚ ãƒ¦ãƒ¼ã‚¶å´ã¯æ˜ç¤ºçš„ã« seed ã‚’æŒ‡å®šã™ã‚‹å¿…è¦ãŒãªããªã‚‹ã¨ã„ã†ã“ã¨ã‚„ã­ã€‚
// readTimeRandom stretches any entropy in the current time // into entropy the length of r and XORs it into r. // This is a fallback for when readRandom does not read // the full requested amount. // Whatever entropy r already contained is preserved. func readTimeRandom(r []byte) { // Inspired by wyrand. // An earlier version of this code used getg().m.procid as well, // but note that this is called so early in startup that procid // is not initialized yet. v := uint64(nanotime()) for len(r) > 0 { v ^= 0xa0761d6478bd642f v *= 0xe7037ed1a0b428db size := 8 if len(r) < 8 { size = len(r) } for i := 0;
